Package via.sep3.group11.tier2.businessLogic

Class HousingLogic

java.lang.Object
via.sep3.group11.tier2.businessLogic.HousingLogic
All Implemented Interfaces:
HousingInterface
@Service public class HousingLogic extends Object implements HousingInterface
Class implementing HousingInterface. Class is implemented with @Service-annotation to mark it as a Spring-component.
See Also:

  • Constructor Details

    • HousingLogic

      public HousingLogic(HousingCommunicationInterface housingDAO, AgreementCommunicationInterface agreementDAO)
      All-argument constructor used to inject the three DAO's needed for communicating with the data-tier.
      Parameters:
      housingDAO - : Data Access Object used for accessing Housing-information in the data-tier.
      agreementDAO - Data Access Object used for accessing Agreement-information in the data-tier.

  • Method Details

    • addHousing

      public HousingDTO addHousing(HousingCreationDTO dto)
      Implementation of a method that is meant to add new housing. A new object is created and all the necessary parameters are added by calling the dto from the method argument. The method uses try/catch block in order to catch any exceptions.
      Specified by:
      addHousing in interface HousingInterface
      Parameters:
      dto - dto that contains all necessary new housing info to be added
      Returns:
      HousingDTO

    • getAvailableHousing

      public HousingListDTO getAvailableHousing()
      Implementation of the method is meant to get all available housing. A new Housing list is created that contains a list of housing that has availability status set to true (the check if it is true is done by Jpa method).
      Specified by:
      getAvailableHousing in interface HousingInterface
      Returns:
      HousingListDTO

    • removeHousing

      public HousingDTO removeHousing(HousingIdDTO dto)
      Implementation of a method that is meant for removing housing from the database. In the method a new object is created that contains a housing object that is referenced by method's argument. IsEmpty check is done in order to make sure that the given id exists and that is followed by a check if the housing is part of the agreement. Both check return HousingDTO with an error message. If the object passes the checks, it's removed.
      Specified by:
      removeHousing in interface HousingInterface
      Parameters:
      dto - data transfer object that contains housing Id, host email and an error message.
      Returns:
      HousingDTO

    • getHousingByHostId

      public HousingListDTO getHousingByHostId(String email)
      Implementation of the method returns all housings that belongs to a host. In the method, a list of housings is created that contains all housings according to the given email in the argument. isEmpty check is done in order either just display a message or return a list of housings.
      Specified by:
      getHousingByHostId in interface HousingInterface
      Parameters:
      email - hosts email
      Returns:
      HousingListDTO
